sequence_destroy: With this function you can destroy a sequence object that has been created dynamically. You supply either the sequence object struct (as returned by the function sequence_create()) or the sequence ID (as returned by the function layer_sequence_get_sequence() or from the sequence instance struct property sequence). This function should be used whenever a dynamically created sequence is no longer required to free up the memory associated with it.
The sequence object struct or ID to destroy
The above code checks to see if the given sequence object exists and if it does it is destroyed.
